parse.title: Vindicta
parse.text:
This article is about the ilujanka. For the boss encounter, see Vindicta & Gorvek. For the achievement, see Vindicta & Gorvek (achievement).
This article has a strategy guide (hard mode).
All information on mechanics, setups, and tactics is on the subpages.

Vindicta is the Ilujanka general of Zaros's army in the Heart of Gielinor. She was raised by Gorvek and is the daughter of Hannibus and Morvannon.

Level 80 Attack is required to face her; however, this may be boosted.

Vindicta and Gorvek are slain.

    • 1.2 Showdown at the Heart

History[edit | edit source]

Early history[edit | edit source]

After Zaros's fall, Zamorak sent the demons Avaryss, the Unceasing, Nymora, the Vengeful and their sister out to track down and eliminate the Dragon Riders who chose to remain loyal to Zaros. The demonic trio led a group of hellhounds to tear the Dragon Rider Morvannon apart, even though she had agreed to join Zamorak. However, the demons didn't know that an egg had avoided them, as they expected the Ilujanka to be infertile. Gorvek, Morvannon's dragon mount, was able to escape with the egg, keeping it in stasis and only letting it hatch when the area was safe, calling it Vindicta in the hopes that the child would avenge the Ilujanka.

Vindicta grew up in Gorvek's care in the Grotworm Lair, who also taught her how to fight and how to use her mother's armour and weapons. Vindicta is larger and more aggressive than her fellow Ilujanka due to spending her entire life on Gielinor. Vindicta resolved to slay the Twin Furies, who were responsible for her mother's death. She was also made aware that her father was Hannibus, though she likewise assumed him to be slain too.

Showdown at the Heart[edit | edit source]

The following takes place during Tales of the God Wars (miniquest).

Vindicta and Gorvek were eventually led to the Heart in the Kharidian Desert, where they stood face to face with the Twin Furies as well as the Sliskean Gregorovic and the Serenist Helwyr. Though her grudge was only against the Twin Furies, both Helwyr and Gregorovic decided that they would fight against her to claim the Heart. She called upon the forces of Zaros to claim the Heart in his name, in addition to curing her dying race.

Sliske's Endgame[edit | edit source]

The following takes place during Sliske's Endgame.

Vindicta joined her lord's entourage alongside Azzanadra and Char during Sliske's Endgame, where she initially confuses the World Guardian as one of Zaros' enemies. Zaros ordered her to stand down, as they were an invaluable asset to his plans. She returns to the Heart after she is expelled from the maze.

The Ambassador's Threat[edit | edit source]

The following takes place during Curse of the Black Stone.

Mr. Mordaut informed Hannibus and the World Guardian about the dragonrider general fighting in the Heart, prompting the two to visit her. Vindicta showed initial disgust at Hannibus and the rest of the Illujanka in general for being too cowardly and just willing to give up at their chance for survival. When she told him that her mother was Morvannon, Hannibus asked her for her father's name, which she told him was Hannibus. She did not believe that the Hannibus before her was her father, as she expected him to be a giant warrior. Hannibus managed to convince her otherwise, and she was delighted to hear the enemy was Kranon, who posed a threat to Zaros's plans. She temporarily left her forces in the Heart and travelled with Gorvek to Daemonheim, where the World Guardian noted that she was slightly happier than usual despite her protests. The pair worked with Hannibus and Shakorexis to destroy Kranon's cannons, after which she returned to the Heart to continue leading her forces.

Visit to Iaia[edit | edit source]

The following takes place during Kerapac Track.

Sometime after stopping the Ambassador, Hannibus brought Vindicta to Iaia. Vindicta was not impressed with her homeworld, as she compared it to an armoured tomb, their inhabitants resigned to death. As the Olun'dai stated that everyone was connected and played a part, she compared it to threads on a needle, and that her role in the Olun'dai was to lead the Ilujanka to a new homeworld. Some of the younger Ilujanka appeared to show interest in Gielinor, where they would be able to ride dragons once more. Hannibus thought her idea was good and that she would appreciate Ilujankan culture, but she stated that she would only do so if the new generation of dragon riders met her expectations.

Withdrawal[edit | edit source]

The following takes place during Azzanadra's Quest.

Sometime after visiting Iaia, Vindicta withdrew from the Heart alongside her forces, since Zaros no longer had need of it.

Evacuating Iaia[edit | edit source]

The following takes place during Extinction.

Vindicta returned to Iaia to speak with Elder Chahoua when the World Guardian, Hannibus, Vicendithas, Moia and Adrasteia arrived on Iaia after entering the rift Seren had left behind on Freneskae. After learning of Seren's intentions, Chahouha believed that the end of all times had come and he had accepted death. Vindicta refused to let everyone on the planet die and assisted the group in evacuating as many Ilujankans as possible before the Elders arrived on the planet, leaving through the World Gate.

Drops[edit | edit source]

Main article: Vindicta & Gorvek § Drops

Once the players defeated the monsters at the last stage of Vindicta & Gorvek encounter, the items will drop on the ground.

    Update history[edit | edit source]

    This information has been compiled as part of the update history project. Some updates may not be included – see here for how to help out!
    • update 7 November 2022 (Update):
      • Herb drops replaced with their seeds instead.
    • patch 15 February 2021 (Update):
      • Vindicta and Gorvek will now face the player when below 100,000 HP.
    • patch 4 May 2020 (Update):
      • Luminite stone spirits have been replaced by orichalcite and drakolith stone spirits.
    • hidden 2019 (Update):
      • Gorvek's fire wall attack now deals standard magic damage, allowing it to be reduced by prayers and other forms of damage reduction.
    • patch 12 August 2019 (Update):
      • Gorvek's spine attack will now only hit the main target and players in close proximity to that target.
    • ninja 10 June 2019 (Update):
      • The frequency of Necrite and Phasmatite stone spirit drops has been reduced across all God Wars Dungeon 2 bosses.
    • patch 20 May 2019 (Update):
      • Both God Wars Dungeon 2 and Elite Dungeon bosses now award more Reaper points and Slayer XP when killed in challenge/hard mode.
    • patch 28 January 2019 (Update):
      • Instead of Runite Stone Spirits, will now drop either Necrite Stone Spirits or Phasmatite Stone Spirits.
      • Instead of Coal Stone Spirits, will now drop Luminite Stone Spirits.
    • patch 15 January 2018 (Update):
      • Players can no longer deal poison damage to Vindicta and Gorvek during the transition phase of the boss fight.
      • Players will no longer lose the Attack option when Vindicta is transitioning to her next boss phase. This will help prevent players from walking under her during the transition.
    • patch 8 January 2018 (Update):
      • Vindicta can now have her boss kill count prestiged.
    • hotfix 3 October 2016 (Update):
      • Slowed down Vindicta's anti-safe spot timer.
      • Vindicta & Helwyr no longer stack enrage when at full health.
    • patch 26 September 2016 (Update):
      • Vindicta & Gorvek will now breathe fire if unable to attack.
    • patch 18 April 2016 (Update):
      • Fixed the examine text on the glimmering scale.
    • patch 11 April 2016 (Update):
      • Players no longer take damage from Gorvek's fire shortly before or after it's spawned or despawned.
    • update 7 March 2016 (Update):
      • Added to game.

    Trivia[edit | edit source]

    • Vindicta is Latin for vengeance and retribution.
    • As of September 2021, there is a bug that causes her phase-2 fire special attack to turn invisible.
    • There was a bug upon release where during the phase transition, Vindicta and Gorvek were "taggable", resulting in the first player to "tag" them obtaining the main drop, even if they did less damage than the other players. This was hotfixed.
    • During the phase transition players can sometimes see Vindicta's weakness changing to crush attacks. Sometime on release, it was also possible to poison her during this transition, but this was quickly fixed.
    • Vindicta was originally intended to be a Chthonian demon, and was changed to an Ilujanka due to concept art drawn by a member of The Watch.[1]
    • After Vindicta mounts Gorvek during the Tales of the God Wars miniquest cutscene, her examine text becomes "More violent, more powerful, more dragon."
    • As of 1 February 2018, the highest kill count for this boss was 60,000 kills for normal mode and 1,355 for hard mode. At this time, this was the record for the most-killed boss in the Heart of Gielinor, equal with Helwyr.[2]
      • This had increased to 100,781 for normal mode and 1,618 for hard mode by 13 December 2018.[3] At this time, she was the most killed boss of the Heart of Gielinor.
    • She is the only boss in the Heart of Gielinor that is immune to the effects of poison in both her normal fight and her hard mode fight. Gregorovic only has poison immunity in his hard mode fight.
    • Vindicta is the only one of Sliske's opposing generals not to have a personal grudge against Gregorovic.
    • Before an update in 2019, Gorvek's dragonfire ignored standard methods of damage reduction, such as Deflect Magic and Devotion.
